data.title: PythonPhot: Simple DAOPHOT-type photometry in Python
data.name: PythonPhot
data.description: Simple DAOPHOT-type photometry in Python translated from IDL AstroLib photometry algorithms.  Please email me with bugs, suggestions, omissions, etc.  The code is citable as part of the Astrophysics Source Code Library (http://ascl.net/1501.010).

evidence: The README describes scripts/modules like `getpsf.py`, `rdpsf.py`, and `pkfit.py` that are imported and run directly in user analysis code (e.g., `gauss,psf,psfmag = getpsf.getpsf(...)`).

The functionality is domain-specific photometry/PSF fitting: "Generates a point-spread function (PSF) from observed stars" and "fit a psf model to an isolated point source", which directly processes scientific imaging data.
Usage examples show importing from the repository and running in-place Python code, with no mention of package managers, releases, or containers, implying distribution via the source repository.
